page.title: 02A Keeper's Life in Assynt
page.content: Keepers conserve game and control vermin(fox,rabbit,crow etc.). Stalking occurs from{August to October.}There are three resident species of deer {(Roe,Red and Sika from Japan)}but it is the red deer which is the most popular. In order to make an efficient cull{30_35 males(stags)and 35_40 hinds {(female)}are shot each year by 0.270 rifle. A keeper rises at 7am. After dressing in a tweedsuit (plus-fours), knee length socks,sturdy lacing boots, thick shirt and perhaps a jumper, he has fried egg,bacon,sausages and a cup of tea for breakfast. Taking telescope or binoculars he leaves for the hill when the shooting party arrives(9.30). About 1pm a sandwich lunch is eaten.He comes home at six or later.Horses or 8 wheeled vehicles are used to retrieve carcases.{Grouse & ptarmigan}are also shot and{salmon and trout}protected.
